channel.title: Listeners on HoneyTrap
channel.description: Recent content in Listeners on HoneyTrap

item.title: Agent
item.description: Description Theagent listener allows the usage of agents as “providers” of traffic. When starting HoneyTrap with an Agent listener, You will have displayed a random HoneyTrap Agent Server public Key, such as: Honeytrap Agent Server public key: 12a9ce17adc2ad1553040b19c33575bbef9fe7adedc6d14a669251a8f7f7a256 You will have to enter this key in the configuration file of each of your agents. Syntax [listener] type="agent" How many? There needs to be one listener and there can only be one.

item.title: Netstack
item.description: Description The netstack listener is a custom network stack implementation. Syntax [listener] type="netstack" How many? There needs to be one listener and there can only be one. Arguments in config file There are 3 arguments in netstack listener: argument default setting explanation addr none Set the address of <…> interfaces none Set the list of interfaces you want to listen on.

item.title: Raw
item.description: Description The raw listener will listen on all ports of an interface. Syntax [listener] type="raw" How many? There needs to be one listener and there can only be one. You can select as many interfaces as you want. Arguments in config file There is 1 argument in Raw listener: argument default setting explanation interfaces none Set the list of interfaces you want to listen on.

item.title: Tap
item.description: Description The tap listener will log all events from a tap interface. Syntax [listener] type="tap" How many? There needs to be one listener and there can only be one. Arguments in config file There are no arguments in tap listener. Example [listener] type="tap" Availability Linux MacOS tap yes no

item.title: Tun
item.description: Description The tun listener will log all events from a tun interface. Syntax [listener] type="tun" How many? There needs to be one listener and there can only be one. Arguments in config file There are no arguments in tun listener. Example [listener] type="tun" Availability Linux MacOS tun <…> yes

item.title: Socket
item.description: Description The socket listener allows to choose on which ports you want to listen on as “providers” of traffic. When starting HoneyTrap with a Socket listener, for each port opened you will be displayed: 09:54:45.990 listeners/socket â–¶ INFO 00b Listener started: tcp/:8022 This means that HoneyTrap is now listening on tcp/8022. Syntax [listener] type="socket" How many? There needs to be one listener and there can only be one.
